annotation.TEXT: Alright, let's do this!
...Yep! You can enter the bottom of that white pipe, and that's how you get here!
Focus on collecting the highest coins first while you're inflated, since you can reach the lowest coins just by jumping from the ground after you deflate.
Nuts. Fired the red shell slightly too early to hit that Piranha Plant on the left. It would've been cool if I nailed it and made it coincide with me green-shelling the right one.
Each additional set of 8 rooms after the first have certain puzzles already solved, and the reset doors just send the player to the appropriate set. So, there you go.
Oh, and don't forget that you can use the wall springboard glitch in a lot of places in the first half of this level!
Whoa, I'm surprised I didn't lose the ice block to that Spike Top there.
Make sure that turn block is spinning when the eating block gets to it so that it turns upward and continues along the cement block path.
Whoa, hello! So, I put a cement block behind the coin overlapping the silver P up above, so that it would just fall down to you on subsequent visits, as a convenience.
But, if you want, you could just step on the brown block that coin block turns into, before hitting the blue P, then quickly hit the blue P afterwards.
Alright, let's head back outside...
But, by tossing the block straight up (and then stepping out of the way so you don't hit it again), it'll have no horiz. momentum and can fall all the way down the shaft just fine.
Zwee!
Alright, with that HB burnt to a crisp, let's check out the upper area here.
And of course, don't forget to grab the Yoshi coin on the right here.
Also, I'll try to show off the paths in the first half that I didn't show last time.
Got 25 coins from that multi-coin block, which is pretty good.
You could ride this winged ? block, but I'll just hit it to get the flower from it.
Hmm... How does one reach the ? block above this muncher here? The silver P-switch earlier certainly wouldn't last long enough...
Ah, there's the silver P we need! Oh, and if you look to the left, you'll see a "P" in the bushes. In addition, if you R-scroll to the right, you'll see the bushes spell out "HI!".
Zwee! Almost forgot to show that the midpoint bar always respawns. This way, players starting at the midpoint entrance can just go "zwee" again for a free embiggening.
Hello, and welcome back to my VLDCX level! This time, I'll be playing An Unusual Trip Out a bit more thoroughly. But first, I'm suffering from a bad case of embiggening...
Alright, much better.
And, how would one reach that moon? Well, I'll show that off another time. For now, let's return to the main area here.
Awesome! Yeah, you have to be nearly perfect to reach that bonus star there. There's extremely little leeway.
So, yeah. You probably saw this path last episode, and this is how you get to it (without glitches), as it's disconnected from the rest of the screw-up-able puzzle room.
In addition, every turn block with coins underneath contains something.
Nuts. My OCD is bothered by the fact that I missed two of the ? blocks down there, even if they just contain coins.
Can't quite see the entirety of the "!", but you can see enough of it at least. Anyway, let's take this silver P back to the football room!
Oh, and I can properly show off the lazy-man's multi-coin block this time, since I finished off the previous multi-coin block I started.
The vine isn't anything important, but it does allow you to easily get a perfect 32 coins from an unmarked multi-coin block up here.
So, just bump off the Spike Top, grab a power up from the lower note block if you want, and bounce up to grab the Yoshi coin.
So, up here is a Yoshi coin and a "KICK ME" sign. Well, let's do what it says! And, time it right to nail the red Parakoopa on the left for a 1-up!
Oh, what's this? That block up there wasn't there before. Well, it was hidden behind a coin, which I collected last time I was out here.
And then there's this eating block puzzle out here, which definitely requires a blue P-switch... Well, I did make this pipe two-way for a reason.
First of all, I put an invisible block sprite here to prevent the player from being able to fall through the floor here or get crush-killed. And, if you duck and spin jump here...
In fact, until you actually enter the Fun House at the end of the level, you can always backtrack all the way back to the beginning if you want.
You can also bounce off this note block or the wall springboard to get up.
Oh, yeah. Remember how I said last time that the checkpoint 1-up unlocked a shortcut through this room? Well, here it is.
8-life combo!
See the "L"-shape of bushes there? L-scroll here for a better view of what's to the left.
Yeah, I'm not losing my Fire Flower to this Chuck again.
Push!
Unfortunately, that Chuck is a bit of a jerk, and will usually knock the Mega Mole into that pit, but you can just make Mega Mole respawn behind you here.
Also, while that coin on the ground there isn't technically vital, I inserted it as a Map16 object as well, since it's intended to be used to start the eating block.
Oh, and while I'm here, I want another crack at the bonus invincibility star, which I can't get with the shortcut vine. I'll have to play through the whole room normally again.
Reason being, if Mario jumps in front of the eating block as it zips, he could get crush-killed in the pipes there, but the invisible block sprites seem to prevent that.
Oh, and there's one more thing you can do here with the springboard, which is important...
Alright, here we go!
Now, with that bonus star, it should be easy to just race over here and tear through the footballs.
I guess I'll use the leftover silver P for one last combo here. Just beware that the Chucks aren't affected.
BTW, I want to point out something here. If you try to simply drop an ice block down this shaft, it'll have a little horiz. momentum, and crash into the wall on the way down.
Oh, but there are a couple turn blocks here without coins under them that contain stuff, like that vine.
Yeah, strangely, in this VLDCX Base ROM, when the eating block hits an up/left/right junction, it'll zip 5 tiles down and right, then attach to anything solid it finds there!
Okay, now let's begin by looking for pi in the sky at the start.
3-life combo!
Whoops, I activated the eating block to the left. Yeah, after the eating block sprite has spawned, stepping on any brown used block object will trigger it.
BTW, for those that are still wondering how the reset doors in this room really work, this sublevel is actually made up of 4 near-identical copies of the same 8 screens.
Mario: Thanks, Dr. Muncher! How much do I owe you? Dr. Muncher: No charge! My service is free! Ain't I nice?
Whoa, what?!
Now for the screw-up-able puzzle room.
This is nice, because the springboard has one more use up ahead.
This means, in addition to the 5th Yoshi coin, you get access to the green star block too! Oh, and I put invisible block sprites on the yellow pipe there to prevent crush-kills.
Bah, I was too slow to include that Swooper to the left in the combo. Oh, well. Now let's go back outside once again with this blue P!
BTW, the loose coins that are part of the eating block puzzle here are vital, so I once again inserted them as Map16 objects.
Umm... Well, that eating block just got launched into outer space. If only there was a way for that eating block to be useful...
Perfect. By doing it that way, it's possible to collect every coin in this room.
That's because I used the Map16 to put the midpoint bar in, just like with the vital coins at the beginning of this room.
...you'll find a hidden pop-up mushroom, a flower, and a 1-up. Nothing important, but it's a nice little Easter egg for those that like abusing the duck-spin-jump glitch.
Yeah, to hit this turn block with coins under it, just after midpoint.
Oh, and there's a hidden 1-up block above that line of coins.
And now to end with a hearty scream!
Up here, you'll find a few things. There's a standard springboard, and a Piranha Plant that you can just feel free to burninate.
This ? block contains a P-balloon, to help you reach the highest coins in this room.
So, yeah. That bonus room does skip a little bit of the first half of the level, but it's always easy enough to backtrack.
Just get rid of the Banzai Bill and anyone else that could get in your way, position yourself on the left edge of this note block, and hold either A or B.
Yep, there's the blue P we need! Oh, and let's get a nice silver coin combo while I'm at it.
There's now a vine block and a note block containing a power up here, which were hidden behind checkpoint 1-up objects.
DOUBLE KILL!
3-life combo!
Oh, that was a neat way to collect that Fire Flower.
Oh, hello there, winged ? block. It contains a Fire Flower (or mushroom if you're small), but you really just want to ride it to the left to find this pipe in the sky.
Well, I'll get back to that in a moment.
Oh, another reason I wanted to repeat this room in full-- there are secrets right here.
That one just contains a Super Mushroom, even if you're big. And then, there's the one down here that I showed off last time, which houses a 1-up.
Ow... I'm okay!
So, I found the pi in the sky, but what about Ag underfoot? And, what could that "Luigi wins by doing nothing" hint mean? Find out next time!
BTW, if you want to get the most out of a star-kill combo here, wait until the silver P has expired before hitting the blue one, so that none of the duders will be silver coins.
And, if you've done everything correctly, the Yoshi coin will be unlocked for you!
Unfortunately, you'll only get 7 coins from this multi-coin block. Oh, well. Now, over here, instead of taking the math platforms, let's ride the Mega Mole.
Maybe the blue P-switch is in the ? block above the muncher here, but we'd still need a silver P-switch, and one that's much closer than the earlier silver P...
Anyway, take this blue pipe on the right to return to the main area, which'll conveniently place you right next to the springboard.
Fun fact: That scream apparently originated from a Half-Life Korean dub. I'll put a link to it in the description.
To be continued... Yo!
Gotta love that wall springboard glitch. Anyway, there's stuff to the upper-left here, and there's multiple ways to get up there.
Ah, remember the videos I made showing this? Yep, this is the pi bonus room!
Now, on this trip through the level, I do want to get all of the Yoshi coins, including this one down here.
